CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: The microstructure of blend films of the copolymers with fullerene derivatives is known to have a large effect on the charge transport properties and the corresponding efficiencies of PSCs. Here , the atomic force microscopy ( AFM ) was applied to investigate the morphology of the blend film of the polymer : PC 70 BM fabricated from CB and DCB solutions , respectively , as shown in Fig. 3. For PDTP-BT : PC 70 BM , both CB and DCB gave the films with obvious phase separation with a root mean square ( RMS ) of 2.222 nm and 0.880 nm , respectively , which might be due to the poor miscibility of the two materials. For PDTP - DTBT and PDTP-DT2BT , the blend film of polymer / PC 70 BM spin - coated from CB was also rough , but the blend films fabricated from DCB displayed a much smoother surface with a RMS of 0.188 nm and 0.259 nm , respectively. This smaller roughness of the blend film indicates that the domain size of the phase separation of the donor - acceptor interpenetrating network could be reduced , which could be beneficial for the exciton charge separation and charge transport. These results indicate that the morphologies of these polymers with PC 70 BM are quite sensitive to the solvents used for device processing and the introduction of a thienyl spacer could improve the miscibility . The photovoltaic properties of the three copolymers PDTP-BT , PDTP - DTBT and PDTP-DT2BT were studied by fabricating bulk heterojunction BHJ - type PSCs with a conventional sandwich configuration of ITO / PEDOT : PSS / polymer : PC 70 BM / Ca / Al. The effective areas of the PSCs , contributing to photocurrent , were defined using a metal photomask during irradiation with simulated solar light. The devices were optimized by changing many factors , such as the ratio of the donor and the acceptor , the thickness of blend films and the cathode metal. The best performance was obtained with the thickness of the active layer of 80-90 nm , the copolymers : PC 70 BM ratio of 1 : 2 ( by weight ) and the Ca / Al used as the cathode. Fig. 4 shows the J-V curves of the optimized PSCs based on the three polymers under illumination of AM 1.5 simulated solar light ( 100 mW cm^-2 ). The PSCs with two kinds of solvents CB and DCB for the spin - coating of the active layers were investigated , and the corresponding photovoltaic parameters of the devices open - circuit voltage ( V OC ) , short - circuit current density ( J SC ) , fill factor ( FF ) and PCE are summarized in Table 2. When CB was used as the solvent , all the combinations showed a relatively low PCE of 0.87% , 1.97% and 1.92% in the devices with PDTP-BT : PC 70 BM , PDTP - DTBT : PC 70 BM and PDTP-DT2BT : PC 70 BM respectively.

Let's think step by step.

Sure, let's identify the "Material Name" entities in the paragraph:

1. PC 70 BM: This is mentioned several times in the paragraph as the polymer used in the blend films.
2. CB: This is mentioned as the solvent used for spin-coating the active layers of the PSCs.
3. DCB: This is also mentioned as another solvent used for spin-coating the active layers of the PSCs.
4. PDTP-BT: This is a copolymer mentioned in the paragraph as one of the three copolymers studied.
5. PDTP-DTBT: This is another copolymer mentioned in the paragraph as one of the three copolymers studied.
6. PDTP-DT2BT: This is the third copolymer mentioned in the paragraph as one of the three copolymers studied.
7. ITO: This is mentioned as the material used for the anode of the PSCs.
8. PEDOT: This is mentioned as the material used for the hole transport layer of the PSCs.
9. PSS: This is mentioned as the material used for the electron transport layer of the PSCs.
10. Ca: This is mentioned as the cathode material used in the PSCs.
11. Al: This is also mentioned as another cathode material used in the PSCs.

These are the "Material Name" entities mentioned in the paragraph.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Of course! Here are the entities that refer to "Material Name" in the paragraph:

1. PC 70 BM
2. PDTP-BT
3. PDTP-DTBT
4. PDTP-DT2BT

These are the only entities in the paragraph that refer directly to "Material Name".

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities mentioned in the paragraph as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name":

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PC 70 BM |
| PDTP-BT |
| PDTP-DTBT |
| PDTP-DT2BT |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

Please identify the Property Names of materials in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: The microstructure of blend films of the copolymers with fullerene derivatives is known to have a large effect on the charge transport properties and the corresponding efficiencies of PSCs. For PDTP-BT : PC 70 BM , both CB and DCB gave the films with obvious phase separation with a root mean square ( RMS ) of 2.222 nm and 0.880 nm , respectively , which might be due to the poor miscibility of the two materials. For PDTP - DTBT and PDTP-DT2BT , the blend film of polymer / PC 70 BM spin - coated from CB was also rough , but the blend films fabricated from DCB displayed a much smoother surface with a RMS of 0.188 nm and 0.259 nm , respectively. This smaller roughness of the blend film indicates that the domain size of the phase separation of the donor - acceptor interpenetrating network could be reduced , which could be beneficial for the exciton charge separation and charge transport. These results indicate that the morphologies of these polymers with PC 70 BM are quite sensitive to the solvents used for device processing and the introduction of a thienyl spacer could improve the miscibility . When CB was used as the solvent , all the combinations showed a relatively low PCE of 0.87% , 1.97% and 1.92% in the devices with PDTP-BT : PC 70 BM , PDTP - DTBT : PC 70 BM and PDTP-DT2BT : PC 70 BM respectively.

Let's think step by step.

Sure, I'd be happy to help you identify the property names of materials mentioned in the paragraph! Here are the materials mentioned in the paragraph along with their property names:

1. Polymer: PC 70 BM
 * Property name: Poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythiophene) (PEDOT)
2. Solvents:
 * CB (chlorobenzene)
 * DCB (dichlorobenzene)
3. Copolymers:
 * PDTP-BT (polymer donor-acceptor copolymer with thienyl spacer)
 * PDTP-DTBT (polymer donor-acceptor copolymer with thienyl spacer and dithienyl spacer)
 * PDTP-DT2BT (polymer donor-acceptor copolymer with thienyl spacer, dithienyl spacer, and second thienyl spacer)
4. Metal: Al
5. Cathode: Ca

Note that some of the materials are mentioned multiple times in the paragraph, but I have only listed each material once in the property name column.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Property Name of Material.

Of course! Here are the entities that refer to the property name of materials in the paragraph:

1. PC 70 BM (Poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythiophene))
2. PDTP-BT (polymer donor-acceptor copolymer with thienyl spacer)
3. PDTP-DTBT (polymer donor-acceptor copolymer with thienyl spacer and dithienyl spacer)
4. PDTP-DT2BT (polymer donor-acceptor copolymer with thienyl spacer, dithienyl spacer, and second thienyl spacer)

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any other questions.

PV.content:
Please identify the Values (number + unit) of material properties in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: The microstructure of blend films of the copolymers with fullerene derivatives is known to have a large effect on the charge transport properties and the corresponding efficiencies of PSCs. Here , the atomic force microscopy ( AFM ) was applied to investigate the morphology of the blend film of the polymer : PC 70 BM fabricated from CB and DCB solutions , respectively , as shown in Fig. 3. For PDTP-BT : PC 70 BM , both CB and DCB gave the films with obvious phase separation with a root mean square ( RMS ) of 2.222 nm and 0.880 nm , respectively , which might be due to the poor miscibility of the two materials. For PDTP - DTBT and PDTP-DT2BT , the blend film of polymer / PC 70 BM spin - coated from CB was also rough , but the blend films fabricated from DCB displayed a much smoother surface with a RMS of 0.188 nm and 0.259 nm , respectively. This smaller roughness of the blend film indicates that the domain size of the phase separation of the donor - acceptor interpenetrating network could be reduced , which could be beneficial for the exciton charge separation and charge transport. These results indicate that the morphologies of these polymers with PC 70 BM are quite sensitive to the solvents used for device processing and the introduction of a thienyl spacer could improve the miscibility . The photovoltaic properties of the three copolymers PDTP-BT , PDTP - DTBT and PDTP-DT2BT were studied by fabricating bulk heterojunction BHJ - type PSCs with a conventional sandwich configuration of ITO / PEDOT : PSS / polymer : PC 70 BM / Ca / Al. The effective areas of the PSCs , contributing to photocurrent , were defined using a metal photomask during irradiation with simulated solar light. The devices were optimized by changing many factors , such as the ratio of the donor and the acceptor , the thickness of blend films and the cathode metal. The best performance was obtained with the thickness of the active layer of 80-90 nm , the copolymers : PC 70 BM ratio of 1 : 2 ( by weight ) and the Ca / Al used as the cathode. Fig. 4 shows the J-V curves of the optimized PSCs based on the three polymers under illumination of AM 1.5 simulated solar light ( 100 mW cm^-2 ). The PSCs with two kinds of solvents CB and DCB for the spin - coating of the active layers were investigated , and the corresponding photovoltaic parameters of the devices open - circuit voltage ( V OC ) , short - circuit current density ( J SC ) , fill factor ( FF ) and PCE are summarized in Table 2. When CB was used as the solvent , all the combinations showed a relatively low PCE of 0.87% , 1.97% and 1.92% in the devices with PDTP-BT : PC 70 BM , PDTP - DTBT : PC 70 BM and PDTP-DT2BT : PC 70 BM respectively.

Let's think step by step.

Sure, let's identify the values of material properties mentioned in the paragraph:

1. Atomic force microscopy (AFM) resolution:
AFM resolution is not explicitly mentioned in the paragraph, but it can be inferred that the AFM resolution is high enough to observe the morphology of the blend film with nanoscale details.
2. Root mean square (RMS) of the blend film:
The RMS of the blend film is mentioned as 2.222 nm for PDTP-BT : PC 70 BM, 0.880 nm for PDTP-DTBT : PC 70 BM, and 0.188 nm for PDTP-DT2BT : PC 70 BM.
3. Thickness of the active layer:
The thickness of the active layer is mentioned as 80-90 nm for the optimized devices.
4. Copolymers : PC 70 BM ratio:
The ratio of copolymers to PC 70 BM is mentioned as 1 : 2 (by weight) for the optimized devices.
5. Cathode metal:
The cathode metal used in the devices is mentioned as Ca / Al.
6. Photovoltaic parameters:
The photovoltaic parameters of the devices are summarized in Table 2, including open-circuit voltage (VOC), short-circuit current density (JSC), fill factor (FF), and power conversion efficiency (PCE). The values of these parameters are not explicitly mentioned in the paragraph, but they can be found in Table 2.

Note: The values of the material properties mentioned in the paragraph are for the devices fabricated using the spin-coating method with CB as the solvent. The values for devices fabricated with DCB as the solvent are not mentioned in the paragraph.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

Sure, here are the entities that clearly refer to the value of material properties in the given text:

1. "2.222 nm" - This is the RMS value of the blend film.
2. "0.880 nm" - This is the RMS value of the blend film for PDTP-DTBT : PC 70 BM.
3. "0.188 nm" - This is the RMS value of the blend film for PDTP-DT2BT : PC 70 BM.
4. "80-90 nm" - This is the thickness of the active layer.
5. "1 : 2 (by weight)" - This is the ratio of copolymers to PC 70 BM used in the devices.
6. "Ca / Al" - This is the cathode metal used in the devices.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any other questions.
